intro: Pseudogynoxys durandii, commonly known as the Durand's pseudogynoxys, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Pseudogynoxys durandii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
